1DF7778716D54501AAB5FD3A5F3467FE.description:
Celebrations of the Liturgical year will continue in class and
with the parish community. These should include Marian feasts/Holy Days and other saints’ feasts

D8C258863C124568831DB7256C530B92.description:
Students will compose prayers of praise, thanksgiving, remorse,
and petition

893D003DF29F439FB952CC2F37863AA5.description: The rituals and prayers of each sacrament

CE7D777291DE4380828509156A24304E.description: The parts of the Mass and its major prayers and rituals

3AACECA6FA07433EAEB64CE1529BDDB2.description: The Lord’s Prayer, given to us by Christ, is the prayer of the Church. It is truly the summary of the whole Gospel and it serves as a basis for the Christian life

3B7377354D01423DBFAFA3F9B1450188.description:
Catholics are encouraged to participate in the following “rhythms of prayer:” a.Sunday celebrations of the Eucharist with parish community; b. Grace before and after meals; c. Daily morning and evening prayers
d. Celebrations of the liturgical year, its Holy Days of
Obligations and various feasts

C6574BCFD62542EBBD01FBC3D90245E5.description: Various expressions of prayer is encouraged, especially vocal reciting of informal and traditional prayers, meditation, and contemplation

7E18A87FC5854446BF56F156E4200F7D.description: Church buildings, as “houses of God,” are the proper places for the liturgical prayer of the parish community. They are also the privileged places for adoration of the real presence of Christ in the Blessed Sacrament

4AB843C637CB4C09AC305D8239F9E9DC.description: The Christian family, based on the sacrament of matrimony, is the first place of education in prayer

B366A931FECF47B583D74ABF6A0F1E0E.description: The lives of the saints serve as inspiration for Christian prayer. In our communion with them, the saints continue to pray with us to the Father on our behalf. We can and should ask them to intercede for us and for the whole world

DF3A368DBE9A47DCB7E7777EA5BF7BD4.description: Christian prayer is nourished by the Word of God and by celebrations of the liturgy

A53177BB66464452A0FCC654C3859C9C.description: Jesus’ prayers to the Father serve as a model to Christians. In the Gospels, these prayers had the following forms: blessing, petition, intercession, thanksgiving and praise

6F519F2CBC0F4C8794AB6B28C7729A47.description: Prayer is the raising of one’s heart and mind to God. It is always a response, inspired by the Holy Spirit, to God’s loving call

9D05CD25B21D4605A398264DE523A367.description: Venial sin weakens charity; it does not break the covenant with God. With God’s grace it is humanly reparable

9D0B82DE7AB244818C4EF15D25B639B2.description: Mortal sin destroys charity in the heart of a person by a grave violation of God’s law; it turns a person away from God. For a sin to be mortal, three conditions must together be met: grave matter, full knowledge, and deliberate consent.

364EC3ED99AA4097A936C31EE2F102E7.description: Sin is an offense against God and is a failure in genuine love for God and neighbor. It wounds the nature of the human person and injures unity among all people.

B1931B88A03C467D8338C5BDAE059D22.description: God gave people the power of freedom so that by their own choice, they might seek and love God and attain the holiness and happiness for which they were made

8FC149D0AA744466AF5D2F07B3E061FA.description: The Holy Spirit gives us grace to help us grow in spiritual freedom so that we may collaborate with him in his work in the Church and in the world

8400F04BDF9641138A7A4996C023AF63.description: By his Passion, Christ delivered us from Satan and from sin. He merited for us life in the Holy Spirit and his grace restores what sin damaged in us

98F29DCB4EAE45B79191F0F6FB50805D.description: Through reason, every person can recognize the voice of God that urges him or her to “do what is good and avoid what is evil.” Everyone is obliged to obey this law, which makes itself heard in conscience and is fulfilled in the love of God and neighbor

E72DE5061AFC468F9B385D75A271FAE6.description:
The dignity of the human person is based in his/her creation in the
image and likeness of God. Every person has the right to be recognized as a free and responsible being. All owe to each other the duty of respect

2B7B17ADE44C4DB682FABD7E5AA9F269.description: Divorce separates what God has joined together. The remarriage of persons for a living, lawful spouse contravenes the plan and law of God as taught by Christ. They are not separated from the Church, but they cannot receive Eucharistic communion

29F24F9A0D484B0C9C4E762A5A2E6B96.description: Marriage is based on the consent of the man and woman to give themselves freely to each other (mutually and exclusively) in order to live a covenant of faithful and fruitful love

C64598D31A94461492FF0DCFA5DD35CB.description: Instruction in each of the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church should include the following: The sacrament of Matrimony signifies the union of Christ and the Church. By its very nature it is ordered to the good of the couple, as well as to the generation and education of children

E9DA7F396484417391821F866162898C.description: The “laying on of hands” by a bishop confers the Sacrament of Holy Orders. Ordination imprints an indelible sacramental character

83DD25923FD24921A646EED1A78BFE04.description: Ordained ministry is conferred and exercised in three degrees: bishops, presbyters and Deacons

D8A138F0CA394FF9A19D62DE3B2D22FA.description: Instruction in each of the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church should include the following: Through Baptism all the faithful share in the Priesthood of Christ

A941E14A90BA4B319A7ECA896A050542.description: The celebration of this rite consists of the anointing of the forehead and hand of the sick person by a Priest, accompanied by the liturgical prayer of the Priest asking for the special grace of this sacrament

454D0A4D5ECC4F98943C628A759F17D8.description: Instruction in each of the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church should include the following: The purpose of the Anointing of the Sick is the conferral of a special grace on the Christian experiencing the condition of grave illness/injury or old age

D5CA91E1BE37426B848A28B451D903C5.description: A person seeking reconciliation with God and with the Church must confess to a Priest all the unconfessed grave sins he/she can remember after a careful examination of conscience. The Confession of venial sins, without being necessary in itself, is nevertheless strongly recommended by the Church

01C46917EE1B465C87BC4A12F1359E28.description: Instruction in each of the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church should include the following: The Sacrament of Penance consists of the penitent’s repentance, Confession of sins to a Priest, and the intention to make or do acts of reparation recommended by the Priest

0EFC1832D34146CB9FA0C3E7D0A03490.description: The Eucharist is the memorial of Christ’s Passover, the work of salvation accomplished by his life, death and resurrection. This reality is made present by the liturgical action

D7CCEAD2E9744FC9B10E3BA8E7B5643C.description: The Eucharistic celebration always includes: the proclamation of the Word of God; thanksgiving to God the Father especially for the gift of his Son; the consecration of bread and wine; and participation in the liturgical banquet by receiving the Lord’s body and blood

A79B9825984946BBBD9B80E9D103C9D8.description: Instruction in each of the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church should include the following: The Eucharist is the source and the summit of the Church’s life

613B684CA54B466B9594CAAABB3512C4.description: The essential rite of Confirmation is anointing the forehead of the baptized with sacred chrism, together with the laying on of the minister’s hands with the words “Be sealed with the gift of the Holy Spirit

3362F1F81E0F43A8A4C857BEA35E19D0.description: Instruction in each of the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church should include the following: Confirmation perfects Baptismal grace by the conferring of the Holy Spirit in order to deepen our participation in God’s life, strengthen our bond with the Church and its mission, and help us to bear witness to Christian faith in words and deeds

7F49E2806C4C4EBDA4F0B095FAD5E211.description: The graced fruit of Baptism includes the forgiveness of Original Sin and all personal sins, birth into the new life by which a person becomes an adopted child of the Father, a member of Christ and a Temple of the Holy Spirit. By this a person is incorporated into the Church, the Body of Christ and made a sharer in the Priesthood of Christ

A4ACC1BE31B5464E8EECB31BE96BA7F4.description:
The essential rite of Baptism consists in immersing the candidate in water or pouring water on his head, while pronouncing the invocation of the Most Holy Trinity: the Father, Son and Holy Spirit; Confirmation
Confirmation perfects Baptismal grace by the conferring of the Holy Spirit in order to deepen our participation in God’s life, strengthen our bond with the Church and its mission, and help us to bear witness to Christian faith in words and deeds; The essential rite of Confirmation is anointing the forehead of the baptized with sacred chrism, together with the laying on of the minister’s hands with the words “Be sealed with the gift of the Holy Spirit

A6B2377592A94E75AD3050933B72BB31.description:
Instruction in each of the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church should include the following: Sacraments of Initiation
Baptism:
Christian Initiation is accomplished by three Sacraments together: Baptism, which is the beginning of new life in Christ; Confirmation, which is its strengthening; and the Eucharist, which nourishes the disciple in the journey of faith

5474BF34774443A9A21F9A0DB791E921.description: The celebration of the saints and martyrs during the liturgical year proclaims the Paschal mystery in those who have lived the Gospel to a heroic degree

AFFE497B8BA045098654E07D7EC19ADA.description: By tradition handed down from the Apostles, the Church celebrates the Paschal mystery on the Lord’s Day or Sunday

86277C8E5C5B4F54B329E42ABB6D1E48.description:
The ordained minister is the sacramental bond that ties the liturgical action to what the Apostles said and did and, through them, to the
words and actions of Christ, the source and foundation of the Sacraments

AF6CB3F8B5C746749E43302F9A92EAD6.description: There are seven Sacraments in the Church: Baptism, Confirmation, Eucharist, Penance, Anointing of the Sick, Holy Orders and Matrimony

8A3103E9786045AAABFFE4472B9B29A3.description: Christ now lives and acts in and with his Church. He is always present in his Church and acts through the Sacraments

D7DD75C2224A4D4B83DF5F991DF6B346.description:
In the Christian tradition “liturgy” refers to the participation of the
People of God in the work of God

E8EAB55CE53B4580B2EC381C7C22D0B5.description: The Celebration of the Christian Mystery

89EA0FA818264C61B5A55971039DDE19.description: The Virgin Mary is the Church’s model of faith and charity. She is the “Mother of God” and spiritual mother to all Christians

AE936D02CAD749B99B8BF89DE3E58B2C.description: Catholics believe in the “communion of all the faithful” of Christ. In this communion, the love of God and his saints is always attentive to our prayers

876747DAFEF74107BE01944F6D56395B.description: At the moment of death, every person either enters into the blessedness of Heaven—through Purgatory or immediately, or into immediate and everlasting damnation

3D8BF30C92E944E4BFDF33B2AA94C17C.description: Catholics firmly believe that just as Christ is truly risen from the dead and lives forever, so after death the righteous will life for ever with the risen Christ and he will raise them up on the last day

8D886C4C3887462AA1EE29214F4E068C.description: The four marks of the Church are: One, Holy, Catholic, and Apostolic

121DEA973CF147FAAA7B3D2DC96B7509.description: The Church has always venerated the Scriptures as well as the Lord’s Body. She never ceases to present to the faithful the Bread of Life, taken from the one table of God’s Word and Christ’s Body

AD4F6CB358E1437DA4EA350A742201C8.description: God’s Covenant with the people of Israel was a preparation for the new and perfect covenant given by Christ. The New Covenant in Christ’s blood calls together all people of all nations and races

34BF43D7D71042AF9852E580511C0212.description: As a sacrament, the Church is the sign of God’s love and Christ’s instrument for the salvation of all people

03944B37F5BB4D698E983F07BF94CEAE.description: Through the Church’s Sacraments, Christ gives us his Holy and sanctifying Spirit to the members of his body

2CC51C92EED649BDA55C19EDCBAA7277.description: On the day of Pentecost Christ the Lord pours out the Spirit in abundance

3016D82DBA824DCD85C2DDB91C87ED94.description: By virtue of our Baptism the Holy Spirit gives us the life that originates in the Father and is offered to us in the Son

F4DC166259C04EFEB386EADD123E9E1D.description: Belief in the Incarnation of the Son of God is the distinctive sign of Christian faith.
